intro: Linaria amethystea var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered toadflax, is a variant of the common toadflax species. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe, characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are linear and slightly hairy, contributing to its ornamental appeal in gardens.
